content:
Preparation of K[(Ar-DAB)GaIII(H){N(Ar)C=NAr}] 1. A solution of [K(tmeda)][:Ga(Ar-DAB)] (0.30 g, 0.49 mmol) in THF (10 cm3) was added to a solution of ArN(H)C=NAr (0.18 g, 0.49 mmol) in THF (10 cm3) at −78 °C. The orange reaction mixture was warmed to 20 °C and stirred for 1 h. Volatiles were then removed in vacuo and the residue was extracted into toluene (50 cm3) and filtered. The filtrate was concentrated to ca. 5 cm3 and stored at −30 °C overnight to give pale yellow crystals of 1. A second crop was obtained (0.11 g, 26%). Mp 171–173 °C (decomp.); 1H NMR (300 MHz, C6D6, 298 K): δ 1.02–1.67 (m, 48 H, CH(CH3)2), 3.21 (sept., 3JHH = 6.8 Hz, 2 H, CH(CH3)2), 3.51 (sept., 3JHH = 6.5 Hz, 6 H, CH(CH3)2), 7.02–7.25 (m, 14 H, NCH and Ar–H), Ga-H not observed; MS (EI), m/z (%): 445 (Ga(DAB)H+, 100), 377 (DABH+, 75); IR v/cm−1 (Nujol): 1878 br., s (Ga-H str.), 1665 s, 1595 s, 1563 s, 1354 s, 1316 m, 1256 m, 1210 m, 1100 m, 757 m.

Compound 2, [K(18-crown-6)][(Ar-DAB)GaIII{N(H)N=Fl}{(H)Fl}] (Fl = fluorendiyl), was obtained in low yield (9%) from the 1:2 reaction of [K(tmeda)][:Ga(Ar-DAB)] with 9-diazofluorene (FlN2) in toluene in the presence of an excess of 18-crown-6 at 25 °C. Deep green crystals of 2 deposited from the reaction mixture after 2 h. At present, the mechanism of formation of 2 is unknown but presumably involves hydrogen abstraction from the reaction solvent. The compound displays negligible solubility in normal deuterated solvents. As a result meaningful NMR spectroscopic data for the compound could not be obtained. Mp 93–96 °C (decomp.); MS (EI), m/z (%): 445 (Ga(Ar-DAB)H+, 100), 377 (Ar-DABH+, 63); IR v/cm−1 (Nujol): 3365 m (N–H str.), 1666 s, 1593 s, 1563 s, 1355 s, 1316 m, 1256 m, 1210 m, 757 m; anal. calc. for C71H86N4GaKO6: C 71.05%, H 7.22%, N 4.67%; found: C 70.56%, H 7.01%, N 4.64%.

Compound 3, [K(OEt2)3][(Ar-DAB)GaII(CH2Ph)GaII(Ar-DAB)], was obtained in low yield (6%) from the 1:1 reaction of [K(tmeda)][:Ga(Ar-DAB)] with [BrB(Ar-DAB)] in a mixture of diethyl ether and toluene at 25 °C. Deep red crystals of 3 deposited from the reaction mixture after 5 h. At present, the mechanism of formation of 3 is unknown, but it likely involves oxidation of the gallium(I) starting material by [BrB(Ar-DAB)] to give the known gallium(II) dimer, [{Ga(Ar-DAB)}2] [16]. The toluene solvent could then be deprotonated by an excess of the base, [K(tmeda)][:Ga(Ar-DAB)], yielding K[CH2Ph] which reacts with [{Ga(Ar-DAB)}2] to give compound 3. The compound displays negligible solubility in normal deuterated solvents. As a result meaningful NMR spectroscopic data for the compound could not be obtained. Mp 205–209 °C (decomp.); MS (EI), m/z (%): 889 ({Ga(Ar-DAB)}2H, 23), 445 (Ga(Ar-DAB)H+, 100), 377 (Ar-DABH+, 42); IR v/cm−1 (Nujol): 1666 w, 1587 s, 1351 s, 1316 m, 1259 m, 1098 s, 800 s, 758 m; anal. calc. for C71H109N4Ga2KO3: C 68.48%, H 8.82%, N 4.50%; found: C 68.12%, H 8.71%, N 4.48%.

Preparation of K[(Ar-DAB)GaIII(H){N(Ar)C=NAr}] 1. A solution of [K(tmeda)][:Ga(Ar-DAB)] (0.30 g, 0.49 mmol) in THF (10 cm3) was added to a solution of ArN(H)C=NAr (0.18 g, 0.49 mmol) in THF (10 cm3) at -78 °C. The orange reaction mixture was warmed to 20 °C and stirred for 1 h. Volatiles were then removed in vacuo and the residue was extracted into toluene (50 cm3) and filtered. The filtrate was concentrated to ca. 5 cm3 and stored at -30 °C overnight to give pale yellow crystals of 1. A second crop was obtained (0.11 g, 26%). Mp 171-173 °C (decomp.); 1H NMR (300 MHz, C6D6, 298 K): δ 1.02-1.67 (m, 48 H, CH(CH3)2), 3.21 (sept., 3JHH = 6.8 Hz, 2 H, CH(CH3)2), 3.51 (sept., 3JHH = 6.5 Hz, 6 H, CH(CH3)2), 7.02-7.25 (m, 14 H, NCH and Ar-H), Ga-H not observed; MS (EI), m/z (%): 445 (Ga(DAB)H+, 100), 377 (DABH+, 75); IR v/cm-1 (Nujol): 1878 br., s (Ga-H str.), 1665 s, 1595 s, 1563 s, 1354 s, 1316 m, 1256 m, 1210 m, 1100 m, 757 m.

The compound displays negligible solubility in normal deuterated solvents. As a result meaningful NMR spectroscopic data for the compound could not be obtained. Mp 205-209 °C (decomp.); MS (EI), m/z (%): 889 ({Ga(Ar-DAB)}2H, 23), 445 (Ga(Ar-DAB)H+, 100), 377 (Ar-DABH+, 42); IR v/cm-1 (Nujol): 1666 w, 1587 s, 1351 s, 1316 m, 1259 m, 1098 s, 800 s, 758 m; anal. calc. for C71H109N4Ga2KO3: C 68.48%, H 8.82%, N 4.50%; found: C 68.12%, H 8.71%, N 4.48%.
